title: hmm
content:
Console games. Why? No driver updates to download, no complicated 42-key configurations to toy with, no patches, no unfair advantages for certain players because they use a higher resolution.

With a console game, I can get some friends together, plug in the controllers, and play a game which is on a reliable set of hardware. :-) I like that.

title: Re: hmm
content: I like consoles as well, but PC more, since I'm used to playing platformers with keyboard -- and Keen is for PC. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Other than that, consoles are pretty good, for the reasons Xky said.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: hmm
content:
Well... I would have voted PC for keen, but if you are talking about games, as in what games I like best (discluding Keen, cause that would throw the counter):

Worst to best:

PC - Graphics usually are poor, and to control a complicated game, you use lots of keyboard keys

Cellphones - Although fun, they are not that lastable, and the games are small

Vidoe (via TV) - I like the ones where you move your sword, and the sword on the screen moves 2

Video (consol):

PS2 - Some great classics, but has a visibally poor resolution (I played Star Wars III on an X-Box, and then started playing PS2, and my eyes hurt cause the graphics were so poor compared to X-Box)

GAMECUBE - I love metroid prime!!!

X-Box: Best graphics, outstanding games!!! A+!!!Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society

title: Re: hmm
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Well... some people just splurge on their graphics cards.[hr][/quote]
And then get good graphics as a result. The reason the graphics on your computer are bad is probably because you have an off-the-shelf Dell (or some other Dell-alike brand) with onboard graphics. On PCs, you have to spend more to get a good experience but you get way more as a result.[url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url]
